subject: Productivity
title: Ego Depletion Debate
description: A 60-second lesson on Ego Depletion Debate.

hook.text: Willpower was supposed to be a limited resource, like a battery. Then scientists couldn't replicate the proof.

buildup.text: Roy Baumeister's ego depletion theory dominated psychology for two decades. Self-control drains a mental fuel.

discovery.text: A massive 2016 replication study involving 23 labs failed to confirm the core finding.

twist.text: The debate continues. Some researchers say willpower is limited by belief, not by actual brain energy.

climax.text: Whether willpower is finite or not, relying on it for goals is risky. Systems beat willpower every time.

punchline.text: Don't depend on willpower. Build systems instead.

quiz.question: What happened when the ego depletion theory was retested in 2016?
options: 23 labs failed to confirm the core finding
